org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.storage.sql
Class AeListingResultSetHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.storage.sql.AeListingResultSetHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.commons.dbutils.ResultSetHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
AeAlarmListHandler, AeMessageReceiverListHandler, AeSQLProcessIdsResultSetHandler, AeSQLProcessListResultSetHandler
public abstract class AeListingResultSetHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.commons.dbutils.ResultSetHandler

Provides a template method for reading the results from a filter type listing query.
Note: This class is not intended to be thread safe.

          Whether the ResultSet has more rows.

ResultSetHandler.handle(java.sql.ResultSet)

determineRowCount

protected void determineRowCount()
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Attempts to determine the total number of rows in the ResultSet, reading up to a maximum of the REPORT_SCAN_LIMIT. In the event that there are more rows then the limit then we'll indicate that the search for the end was aborted and use KR's PlusAPI in the web console.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

readRows

protected void readRows(java.sql.ResultSet aResultSet,
                        java.util.List results)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
Walks the result set reading each row and adding the object to its list. This method will keep reading until the max number of rows has been read or until the result set is exhausted.

Parameters:
aResultSet -
results -
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

skipRows

protected void skipRows()
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
Skips the required number of rows based on the filter's starting point.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

next

protected boolean next()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
